title: "sagitta 35" compact bold sans serif, from brochure of a sailing boat of the same name (60s)
content:
Hello,  
I am trying to identify this font. It looks like Swiss 911 ultra compressed, but it isn’t really an exact match.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103075922im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sagitta35_5151.jpg)
 Anyone with better ideas?
author: gijssier

comments.content: It’s from a brochure for a sailing boat of this name, probably from the sixties.

Well, this is a pre-digital typeface, so chances are likely that this exact rendition of the typeface never made it to a digital font. Do you need the closest digital alternative, or do you just want a name?

For the former: that would be [Helvetica Extra Compressed](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103075922/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/helvetica_com_extra_compressed/?&sample_text=sagitta%2035&sample_size=144), no? ;-)  
F
Not exactly; the tops of the curves are rounder and heavier. The numerals are definitively Compacta.

<cite>Not exactly</cite>  
Of course, I was referring to ‘the closest digital alternative’ part.  
Compacta? Indeed! I always forget about that one. Should use [your lists](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103075922/http:/fontfeed.com/archives/extra-bold-ultra-black-fonts/) more often …

I agree with Compacta for the numerals, and Helvetica Extra Compressed (although it could have been slightly more compressed) seems indeed a close match for the name, Helvetica being, I presume, the original to Swiss. Thanks a lot for your help!

There’s even an [Ultra Compressed](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103075922/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/linotype/helvetica_com_ultra_compressed/?&sample_text=sagitta%2035&sample_size=144) – but that seems to be too narrow.

Yes, [Swiss 911](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103075922/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/swiss-911/) is Bitstream’s version of Helvetica.

[Swiss 924](http://web.archive.org/web/20100103075922/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/bitstream/swiss_924_regular_ot/) is Bitstream’s version of Hanseatic, and appears slightly rounder at the top of the curves.
